title: Java Software Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
**Java Engineer | Stockholm | Modern Tech Consultancy** 




  





 My client, a fast growing Boutique consultancy, based in the heart of Stockholm to scale their business massively over the next year.
 



  





***What sets them apart?***




 This customer is an employee-driven-company they strive to make their business decisions around the betterment of their employees careers. This is why, very early on they decided to only pursue projects that utilise very modern tech stacks not only to capitalise on the ever-growing industry and it's innovations but also to ensure their employees are constantly working towards becoming the best Developers and versions of themselves that they can be.
 



  





**Desired Profile:** 



* Between 2-8 years of professional experience utilising a modern Java stack (typically Java 17+)
* Any experience with supporting Techs / Tools such as DevOps, Infrastructure/Networking, Cloud computing (AWS/Azure/GCP), Kubernetes or Kafka etc.
* Based in Stockholm or a commutable surrounding area.
* Fluent English & Swedish speaking.
 *Candidates with limited but progressively improving Swedish speaking capabilities will still be considered, should they be exceptional on all other fronts.*
* Any experience with leadership, mentorship or exp being a Scrum Master will be interesting and advantageous.



  





**What's on offer?:** 



* Extensive training opportunities in modern tech stacks and domains, including a monthly get-together for a day of knowledge sharing and upskilling (during working hours).
* Here you will find an environment of likeminded, passionate, peers and leaders, dedicated to the success and development of one another. Corporate workflows and environments are not prevalent. You will feel your value from Day 1.
* Paying up to 70 000 SEK / Month.
* Annual business trips.
* Consultants are deployed in teams so look forward to working with and upskilling with your colleagues whilst gaining valuable network connections on project.



  





 Sound of interest? Please apply with your up to date CV or email me at TMU@Thor-Companies.com

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
**About The Organisation**
 Surgical Science is a leading provider of medical simulation training and software solutions. Together with healthcare partners and customers worldwide, we enhance patient safety and healthcare outcomes through evidence-based simulation to improve clinical proficiency and performance.
   

  

 We are a fast-growing global organization with offices in Sweden, Israel, the US, Wales, and China. Our diverse and multicultural workplace embraces both onsite and remote team members, fostering a hybrid work environment.
   

  

 We believe in empowering our employees, valuing their unique experiences and knowledge, and encouraging them to make a meaningful impact. Growth and development are at the heart of our culture, and you’ll be part of a welcoming, open team where your creativity is valued.
   

  

 Guided by our core values—respect, curiosity, and perseverance—we strive to create an environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to our shared success.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 You will work with our Stockholm-based team to develop state-of-the-art VR simulations for teaching surgeons. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Using a combination of C++ and Unity/C# to develop and refine advanced surgical simulations with realistic 3D graphics and soft-body dynamics.
* Using the latest VR and hand-tracking technologies to create immersive surgical training.
* ollaborating with a global team, both on-site and remote.


 Together with the team, you will help shape the future of surgical training.
   

  

 This role will be based in Stockholm, Sweden (2 days in the office).
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 To succeed in this role, we are seeking not only technical competence but a person who can fit in our diverse team culture.
   

  

**Must Have Requirements**
* Preferred 5+ years of professional work experience with C++, with minimum requirement of 3 years.
* Experience working with Unity and C#.
* Flexible, problem-solving mindset, comfortable working across the boundaries of C++/C#/Unity.
* You enjoy working in a project-oriented, multicultural environment within a global team.
* You work well independently while also enjoying being part of a collaborative team.
* You are not afraid to reach out to others when facing complex challenges and are open to sharing your knowledge generously.
* A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or an equivalent field.
* An interest in and knowledge of 3D graphics technologies.
* Professional-level English and strong communication skills.


**Nice To Have**
* Experience in soft-body physics simulation.
* Simulation or games development background.
* Experience with VR technologies.
* Experience using Git and Jira.
* Experience with agile methodologies.


**Career Path**
* Exposure to international collaborations
* Grow into a principal developer role or team leader in the future
* Work in a dynamic environment with unique projects


**Benefits**
 🌍 Global environment (English as primary language)
   

  

 💻 Hybrid work
   

  

 ⌚️ Flexible working hours
   

  

 🏩 Private healthcare
   

  

 🧘‍♀️ Wellness allowance
   

  

 📈 Career progression
   

  

 🚗 Parking spots (Gothenburg only)
   

  

 Application
   

  

 If you believe you have the right experience and qualities for success in the role, we look forward to receiving your application.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled Fullstack Developer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain highly reliable and scalable web services and UIs that serve millions of users worldwide, for example our platforms for (UniFi OS, Design Center/InnerSpace, Accounts or Community)
* Collaborate with developers and designers in distributed teams in an agile and fast-paced, international work environment
* Actively participate in projects and voice your ideas and solutions
* Maintain industry-standard programming style and stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience of coding in modern JavaScript, TypeScript, React and Node.js
* Experience of building scalable and high-availability GraphQL/REST APIs and working with SQL databases (Postgres) and key-value stores/message brokers such as Redis
* Solid knowledge about programming, design patterns and web protocols
* Experience of debugging, profiling and optimising web apps
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Ability to lead yourself and your own work as well as collaborate extensively with others
* Familiar with Git and Jira
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Skilled in Go and/or Java
* Experience developing AWS cloud services / DevOps
* Good understanding of networking protocols and architectures
* Familiarity with the agile software development processes


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: Software Engineer - Open banking
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 At Tink, we deliver open banking solutions as a part of Visa. We’re creating the foundations that a new world of finance will be built on. By constantly challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing the ground-breaking services that businesses will use, to revolutionize the way millions of people manage their money. The world of financial services is changing fast, and we will continue to be at the forefront of it.
   

  

  

  

 Tink is building an open banking platform that enables banks, fintechs and startups to develop data-driven financial services. Through one API, Tink allows customers to access aggregated financial data, initiate payments, enrich transactions and build personal finance management tools. Tink connects to more than 3,400 banks that reach over 250 million bank customers across Europe. Our solutions are ready-to-go products, each developed to solve specific problems and bring value to both businesses and their customers.
   

  





**What we offer you:** 
  

  





 You will be working in an international environment where your responsibilities will include:
   

  




* Work with Tink’s technologies which is mainly Java, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Datadog, REST and much more.


* Develop reliable, scalable, high performance and highly distributed systems that power open banking products for different markets using your technical expertise.


* Innovate around new features and measure how these features perform, being instrumental in bringing the product vision to life.


* Collaborate and build high-quality products by following best engineering practices.



 We strongly believe in the power of collaboration, both within our team and in partnership with other teams and stakeholders. Working together is the cornerstone of building exceptional teams, delivering outstanding products, and fostering personal growth. It forms the very essence of our work culture and defines how we operate.
   

  

  

  





 This is a hybrid position, and we would like you to be in office three days per week.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 We are currently seeking a talented individual to join the Engineering organization, working from our office in central Stockholm. We see that you enjoy working with others and that you have a passion for what you do. You want to better the product you are working on as well as your knowledge and skills.
   

  





 We would like you to have:
   

  




* Proven experience working as backend engineer with Java technologies


* Experience with a fast-paced environment that is product centric


* Experience from working with DevOps methodologies and tools


* Experience working with agile methodologies and understand the value of tracking engineering key metrics


**Additional Information**

 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Business Developer
description:
**Om Veat Café** 




  






 Vår ambition är att göra hälsosam och hållbar mat tillgänglig för alla – färska rätter skapade av toppkockar från våra egna recept, tillsammans med handplockade favoriter från restauranger vi älskar. Veat Café är en VC-backad startup baserad i Stockholm med ambitiösa tillväxtplaner för 2025 och framåt.
 




  






 Vi tillagar och levererar varje dag måltider via våra smarta kylskåp till arbetsplatser, sjukhus och skolor. Vi växer snabbt och söker nu en driven och hungrig Business Developer som vill vara med och ta Veat Café till nästa nivå.
 




  





**Om rollen** 




  






 Som Business Developer ansvarar du för att driva tillväxten av nya kundsamarbeten. Du är en central del av vår expansion och jobbar tätt med marknads- och operationsteamet för att skapa attraktiva lösningar för våra B2B-kunder.
 




  






 - Identifiera, prospektera och bygga relationer med nya potentiella företagskunder
 





 - Driva hela säljcykeln från första kontakt till avtalssignering
 





 - Arbeta strukturerat med pipeline och säljdata för att säkerställa hög träffsäkerhet och effektivt resursutnyttjande
 





 - Samarbeta med Customer Success för att säkerställa smidig överlämning och onboarding av nya kunder
 





 - Bidra med insikter och feedback till produkt- och marknadsteamet för att utveckla vårt erbjudande
 




  





**Vi söker dig som** 




  






 - Älskar mat!
 





 - Har en stark "hunter-mentalitet": orädd, social och energisk, och trivs med att hitta, bearbeta och vinna nya affärer
 





 - Är strukturerad och van att arbeta med CRM-system och säljprocesser
 





 - Är resultatorienterad och trivs i en snabb, entreprenöriell miljö där du får stor frihet och ansvar
 





 - Har förmåga att bygga långsiktiga och värdeskapande relationer
 





 - Har tidigare erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning
 




  






 För att lyckas hos oss behöver du också ha ett genuint matintresse och vilja inspirera andra till bättre matvanor. Vi söker en värderingsdriven person som vill skapa förändring. Du gillar att ta ansvar, tänka strategiskt och samtidigt få saker att hända snabbt.
 




  





**Varför Veat Café?** 




  






 Hos oss får du chansen att vara med från tidigt skede och bygga något unikt tillsammans med ett passionerat och starkt värderingsdrivet team. Du blir en nyckelspelare i ett snabbväxande, entreprenöriellt team där dina idéer räknas och din utveckling är en prioritet. Rollen ger dig stort ansvar och möjlighet att påverka både din egen och företagets tillväxt.
 





 Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftig lön, provisionsbaserad bonus och möjlighet att växa tillsammans med oss.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real.
 



  





 Our founders, Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, came to Sweden from Syria when they were kids. Books became their compass, guiding them through the maze of life, and helping them shape their destinies in a new world.
 



  





 Their dream was bold: What if they could unlock the world of books for everyone, making knowledge and inspiration accessible to all? Fast forward a few years, and the tale of Nextory was born.
 



  





 At Nextory, we've crafted a revolutionary monthly subscription that empowers our users to devour books like never before, be it through reading or listening. It's not just a product; it's a passport to endless adventure and enlightenment.
 



  





 And now, we're on a quest to find our next
 **senior software engineer - frontend -** 
 , someone as passionate as we are about making the world a happier place and enriching lives through the world of reading. Join our extraordinary team, and let's script a future where every day is a chapter of discovery, and every book is a key to a richer life.
 



  





**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING** 




 As a
 **senior software engineer - frontend -** 
 at Nextory you will work with developing our website to create an amazing first impression that stands out to our to-be customers. You will be part of an awesome team with expertise in software engineering, product, design, and customer acquisition – all working together with the shared goal of increasing reading by making Nextory’s global website truly outstanding!
 



  





 You will be maintaining a high website performance and enhancing web SEO. The position is based in Stockholm at the Nextory HQ, Odenplan.
 



  





**WHO YOU ARE** 




 We believe that you are currently working in a similar role at a fast-moving company. We believe that you take pride in delivering with both speed and quality, and use practices such as TDD and AI-assisted coding to do that.
 



  





 🔸 We believe you have, for the field, relevant educational background
 



 🔸 We believe you have at least 5 years of experience from working with web development
 



 🔸 Solid proficiency with
 **JavaScript** 
 , especially
 **Vue.js** 
 ,
 **React** 
 , and
 **TypeScript** 




**🔸** 
 Work on CMS-powered features (e.g. CMS likes Strapi / Payload are a plus) to deliver dynamic content experiences
 



 🔸 Drive frontend architecture decisions, API design and ensure seamless integration with backend services
 



 🔸 Experience with DevOps: CI/CD, monitoring, performance optimization, and basic infrastructure understanding
 



 🔸 Experience with Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform is a plus
 



 🔸 Experience with frontend testing frameworks (e.g. Vitest, Jest, Cypress)
 



 🔸 We believe that you have experience from working with code reviews in your daily work
 



 🔸 We believe that you have experience from agile methodologies, and continuous integration and deployment
 



 🔸 Experience with running and analyzing data from A/B tests would make you stand out
 



  





 We believe that you take pride in our product, that you love to drive development, that you are always striving to improve and that you believe that quality is key! You thrive working in a dynamic and unpretentious environment where you take great responsibility for our product and your team.
 



  





 We are looking forward to your application which should include a CV or LinkedIn profile, and preferably a link to your GitHub profile as well.
 



  





 WORK ENVIRONMENT AND IMPORTANT DETAILS
 



 At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success - and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of the working time at our beautiful office!
 



  





 We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in Paris and Bangalore. Our hybrid work policy includes four days in the office and Wednesdays as a work-from-home day.
 



  





 Please note that we do not offer relocation and that a six-month probationary period applies.

title: Fullstack Developer - Web Applications
description:
Why This Job Is for You
   

  

 You want to create modern digital products that make a real impact on people's lives. You enjoy working closely with design and code, making technology shine in challenging projects where the end-user is always in focus. You appreciate the diversity that comes with consulting, but you also love the craft of refining and evolving a product over time in cross-functional product teams.
   

  

 You will be working in DDX (Design & Digital Experience), which is part of our Hardware & Design business area where we combine broad engineering expertise with deep specialist knowledge and a user-centered approach – to develop physical products and digital experiences all the way from concept to large-scale production.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As Senior Fullstack Developer at DDX, you will architect, conceptualize, and code. You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to develop products in a range of exciting projects. You will have the opportunity to influence your own role and the way we work, as well as help drive our culture of creativity and innovation forward.
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams of designers and developers to create world-class digital products.
* Find creative solutions to bring concepts to life, develop responsive and performant websites, and translate UIs into outstanding code.
* Lead the estimation, planning, and prioritization of projects.
* Inspire and mentor junior developers, sharing knowledge and best practices.
* Influence the tech stack and daily work through new technologies and ideas.
* Maintain a strong focus on client needs and team collaboration.


**Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience as a fullstack developer.
* Solid experience with Node.js for backend development.
* Strong skills in JavaScript/TypeScript with React or Angular for frontend development.
* Experience with Next.js and Headless CMS is highly valuable.
* Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools like GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps.
* Bonus points if you have experience with React Server Components.
* Other languages we’ve used from time to time: Golang, Rust, Ruby, C#
* A proactive mindset with a passion for learning, growing, and inspiring others.


 An Exciting Journey with Knightec Group
   

  

 DDX is part of Knightec Group. Together, we form Northern Europe's leading strategic partner in product and digital service development. Combining cross-functional expertise with a holistic business understanding, we help our clients transform strategies into impactful solutions.
   

  

 Joining us means working in an environment where collaboration, creativity, and curiosity thrive. We believe that innovation happens when different perspectives meet — and we live by that every day.
   

  

 Practical Information
   

  

 This is a permanent position with a six-month probationary period. Our office is located in central Stockholm, but we embrace flexible working conditions with a hybrid model. Start date is as soon as possible or by agreement.
   

  

 Submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 2025-06-30. If you have any questions about the role, please reach out to Mikael Westh, Talent Acquisition Specialist. Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Engineer, HubSpot
description:
*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
**About The Role**
 We are looking for talented and committed individuals to join our newly formed Marketing Technology Solutions unit! In this role, you will work at the forefront of digital innovation - using HubSpot as a key platform to enhance digital customer experiences and drive smarter marketing strategies.
   

  

 If you are excited about making an impact through marketing technology, curious about user experience and eager to experiment and iterate - then we would love to hear from you!
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

  

* Technical development, configuration and maintenance of our Hubspot (Marketing automation, Sales Hub, CMS).
* Data analysis, data modelling, data cleaning and data correction.
* Pursue efforts to use our customer data platform to enhance segmentation and marketing automation opportunities.
* Develop testable, maintainable, and well-documented code.
* Collaborate and work independently to plan, design, and complete backlog items.
* Suggest and explore new ideas to improve practices and ways of working.


**About You**
 To succeed and thrive in this role, we see that you have:
   

  

  

* A bachelor's or master's degree holder in computer science or another relevant field.
* +4 years of experience working with digital development and marketing automation.
* You have a strong experience developing integrations using REST API.
* Experience working with the HubSpot API, NodeJS, JavaScript, and custom code.
* Experience of data analysis, data modelling, data cleaning and data correction.
* HubSpot architecture knowledge.
* Understanding of other software development disciplines like QA, DevOps, and cybersecurity.
* You are curious and willing to learn.
* Fluent skills in English, both written and spoken.
* Knowledge about data platforms (Azure, AWS) and their main tools (Databricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake) is considered an advantage.


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and a hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your CV latest on
 **26.5.2025** 
 . We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Guillaume Vicidomini - Senior Manager, Digital Offering at guillaume.vicidomini@fortum.com.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Backend Developer (Ruby/Rails)
description:
**Let's shape the future of renting together.**
**Who We Are**
 Qasa is a fast-growing scale-up transforming the rental housing market across the Nordics. Since launching in 2014, we’ve been focused on making renting easier, safer, and more accessible for both landlords and tenants.
   

  

 What started as a small startup is now the leading rental platform in Sweden — and we’re just getting started. We’re expanding across the Nordics with a highly skilled, driven team passionate about building a product that makes a real difference in people’s lives.
   

  

 If you're excited about having a meaningful impact on a product that helps people find and rent homes — one of life’s most essential needs — then you might be the person we’re looking for.
   

  

 We’re now looking for another
 **Ruby backend developer** 
 to join our team and help shape the platform behind the rental experience for thousands of people across the Nordics.
   

  

**What Will You Do**
* Design and build our scalable backend system in Ruby on Rails
* Work closely with product, design, and other engineers to deliver features end-to-end
* Improve and maintain our API and internal services
* Contribute to architectural decisions and technical direction
* Take ownership of your work, from idea to production


**What You Have**
* 2–10 years of experience working with Ruby and Ruby on Rails
* A solid grasp of system design and architectural principles
* The ability to structure clean, modular, and scalable codebases
* A preference for writing maintainable, understandable code over clever abstractions
* A practical mindset — you're not afraid to build your own solutions when off-the-shelf libraries fall short


**Who You Are**
 You’re humble, collaborative, and thoughtful — someone who sees software development as a team sport. You don’t guard “your” code and are always ready to pair up, share ideas, and iterate together. You take pride in delivering quality work, but never at the expense of others.
   

  

 You thrive in a fast-moving environment, learn quickly, and enjoy challenging yourself. You’re driven to get things done — not because of pressure or competition, but because you care about your work's impact.
   

  

 You value clear communication, kind feedback, and supporting your teammates. The right mindset and a strong cultural fit are more important than checking every box on a tech list. If that sounds like you, you’ll feel right at home here.
   

  

**Why Qasa?**
* A supportive and ambitious team that cares about what we’re building
* A real product solving real problems — used by people every day
* Flexible work: join us in our bright, modern office at Medborgarplatsen in central Stockholm — a recently built space in a prime location
* Competitive salary and benefits
* A chance to make a meaningful impact in a growing company


 Sound like a good fit? We’d love to hear from you. Apply now or reach out if you have questions — we’re happy to chat.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**
**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**
 Now we need you, your ambition, and your expertise to join us as we continue to grow our product offering within Mortgage. You will be joining a small entrepreneurial team working closely within the dynamics of the larger organisation to provide a top-class mortgage comparison service to our customers.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a skilled and well-rounded senior developer who enjoys being engaged in the product development process and actively participating in discovery and prioritization, with an ability to balance delivery speed versus technical necessities. Your focus will be on designing, developing, and maintaining mission-critical backend services, while also contributing to the frontend to ensure seamless customer experiences.
   

  

 You will be working closely with your product manager, designers, and fellow developers to take full ownership of the product lifecycle. We expect you not to shy away from interacting with the full team and asking extensive questions as part of the continuous delivery process.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate in an empowered product team to shape technical solutions that solve real customer problems.
* Participate in all phases of the product development lifecycle, from concept to deployment.
* Design, build, and maintain scalable and secure backend services, including APIs, data models, and infrastructure, that drive customer-facing applications with a focus on performance, reliability, and maintainability.
* Analyse usage data and system performance to inform architectural and product decisions.
* Contribute to frontend development when needed, ensuring a cohesive experience across the stack.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.


**Qualifications**
* Proven track record as a developer with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, preferably with full-stack responsibility and high shipping frequency.
* Relevant Computer Science or Engineering Education (at least at BA level) or equivalent experience from work.
* Solid understanding of software development principles and methodologies.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Bonus if you have experience working with data science, analytics, or machine learning workflows—whether through building data pipelines, supporting experimentation, or integrating predictive models into production systems.


 We value experience or familiarity with our chosen technologies, such as Node.js, React, Docker, AWS, but for the right candidate who has shown curiosity in different technologies and architectures, we will provide the necessary learning environment to quickly get up to speed with our stack and ways of working.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


 Please note!
   

  

 As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.
   

  

 Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for highly skilled Senior Frontend Developer for various teams in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain highly reliable and scalable web services and UIs that serve millions of users worldwide (e.g. UniFi Network, Site Manager, Community or online store)
* Collaborate with developers and designers in distributed teams in an agile and fast-paced, international work environment
* Actively participate in projects and voice your ideas and solutions
* Maintain industry-standard programming style and stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience of coding in modern JavaScript, TypeScript and Node.js
* Very good knowledge of front-end libraries such as React.js
* Good knowledge of programming design patterns and web protocols
* Experience of debugging, profiling and optimising web apps
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Ability to lead yourself and your own work as well as collaborate extensively with others
* Familiar with Git and Jira
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with WebRTC and WebSockets
* BSc degree in Computer Science, or related engineering degree


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: Software and HIL Test Engineer
description:
**Job Title: Software & HIL Test Engineer**
**About Echandia Marine**
 Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a Software Test Engineer with HIL (Hardware-in-the-Loop) experience to join our software development team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software solutions, spanning from an embedded platform to the cloud.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Design, develop and execute automated test suites for software components and systems.
* Develop and maintain test frameworks and infrastructure using Python, C# or NodeJS.
* Integrate software with hardware systems, including HIL setups.
* Work closely with software developers to identify and troubleshoot software defects.
* Plan, design and build physical test systems and upgrade existing setups
* Develop and maintain test documentation and reports.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest testing methodologies and tools.
* Collaborate effectively within a cross-functional team.


**Required Skills:**
* Strong software engineering fundamentals.
* Experience with test automation frameworks and methodologies.
* Proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: Python, C#, NodeJS.
* Experience with hardware integration and automation (e.g., CAN, Modbus).
* Experience in building physical test systems
* Good understanding of electronics and embedded systems
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


**Bonus Points:**
* Experience with Agile development methodologies.
* Experience with Linux systems administration.
* Experience with CI/CD and build automation with GitHub Actions
* Experience with automated web ui testing.
* Experience with embedded software development.
* Good understanding of batteries
* ISTQB certifications is a merit.
* Knowledge of specific industry standards or regulations.

title: Software Engineer - Kreditrisk
company_industry: Financial Services, Banking, and Software Development
description:
Välkommen att bli en viktig del av vårt nystartade team, Kreditrisk! Uppdraget är att säkerställa korrekt riskhantering vid orderläggning samt uppföljning och bevakning. Vi arbetar med systemlösningar som täcker både pre-trade och post-trade, och du får möjlighet att påverka och utveckla några av våra allra mest kritiska plattformar.
 



  





 Känner du att detta kan vara utmaningen du söker? Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt team – tillsammans skapar vi en tryggare och effektivare kredit- och derivathantering för miljoner kunder!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I denna roll ansvarar du bland annat för att designa, utveckla och implementera robusta systemlösningar inom kreditrisk, derivathandel och finansiella instrument. Du arbetar med både pre-trade- och post-trade-processer där du bland annat optimerar prestanda, säkerställer dataintegritet och implementerar avancerade matematiska modeller.
 



  





 Hos oss får du arbeta i en innovativ och dynamisk miljö med stort handlingsutrymme, där din tekniska expertis och ditt driv står i centrum. Du blir en del av ett engagerat team som arbetar agilt och där möjligheter till både teknisk och personlig utveckling erbjuds. Här får du chans att påverka och forma framtidens finanssystem tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden** 



* Designa, utveckla och vidareutveckla våra systemlösningar med fokus på både pre-trade och post-trade.
* Arbeta med migrering och optimering av befintliga system samt utveckling av nya funktioner.
* Använda avancerade matematiska modeller och analyser för att hantera komplexa samband inom kreditrisk och derivathandel.
* Utveckla lösningar i en molnbaserad miljö och säkerställa att systemen integreras sömlöst med bankens övriga ekosystem.
* Kommunicera tekniska och matematiska koncept på ett pedagogiskt sätt samt samarbeta med interna intressenter.



  





**Vi söker dig som** 




 Du har en relevant utbildning inom exempelvis datavetenskap, matematik eller teknisk fysik och gedigen erfarenhet av systemutveckling – gärna från bank, finans eller fintech. Du har ett genuint intresse för finansmarknaden med särskilt fokus på, derivat och handel. Du besitter gedigna kunskaper i
 **Java** 
 och har erfarenhet av att arbeta med affärskritiska system.
 



  





**Det är meriterande om du dessutom har:** 



* Erfarenhet av C++ och fullstackutveckling.
* Kunskaper om molnteknologi (t.ex. GCP, AWS, Azure).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i mindre, självstyrande team med stort eget ansvar.
* En stark analytisk förmåga, med ett strukturerat arbetssätt för att bryta ner komplexa problem och presentera tekniska lösningar på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt.



  





**Ansökan:** 




 Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast den
 **1 juni** 
 . Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR.
 *Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.* 




  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Cloud Engineer
company_industry: Software Development and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
***SaaS Renewables Product Company | Cloud Developer | Stockholm***




  





 Thor Companies is paired with a highly innovative
 **SaaS** 
 company in Stockholm who offer a software solution that is able to monitor and analyse energy usage within commercial buildings. The solution is able to help identify areas of wasted or unnecessary usage in order to cut down, thus driving sustainability. They are looking to invest in their Cloud Development team to take this product to the next level and international scale.
 



  





**Desired Profile:** 



* Between 2-8 years of professional experience in Cloud Computing (AWS/Azure/GCP).
* Based in Stockholm or a commutable surrounding area.
* Any experience with skills like Terraform, Kubernetes, Kibana , (Azure) DevOps etc is advantageous.
* Fluent English & Swedish speaking.
 *Candidates with limited but progressively improving Swedish speaking capabilities will still be considered, should they be exceptional on all other fronts.*
* Any experience with leadership, mentorship or exp being a Scrum Master will be interesting and advantageous.



  





**What's on offer?:** 



* Extensive training opportunities in modern tech stacks and domains, including a monthly get-together for a day of knowledge sharing and upskilling (during working hours).
* Here you will find an environment of likeminded, passionate, peers and leaders, dedicated to the success and development of one another. Corporate workflows and environments are not prevalent. You will feel your value from Day 1!
* **Paying up to 70 000 SEK / Month.**
* Annual business trips.



  





 Sound of interest? Please apply with your up to date CV or email me at TMU@Thor-Companies.com

title: Senior Lead Software Engineer
description:
IFS is a billion-dollar revenue company with 7000+ employees on all continents. Our leading AI technology is the backbone of our award-winning enterprise software solutions, enabling our customers to be their best when it really matters–at the Moment of Service™. Our commitment to internal AI adoption has allowed us to stay at the forefront of technological advancements, ensuring our colleagues can unlock their creativity and productivity, and our solutions are always cutting-edge.
   

  





 At IFS, we’re flexible, we’re innovative, and we’re focused not only on how we can engage with our customers but on how we can make a real change and have a worldwide impact. We help solve some of society’s greatest challenges, fostering a better future through our agility, collaboration, and trust.
   

  





 We celebrate diversity and understand our responsibility to reflect the diverse world we work in. We are committed to promoting an inclusive workforce that fully represents the many different cultures, backgrounds, and viewpoints of our customers, our partners, and our communities. As a truly international company serving people from around the globe, we realize that our success is tantamount to the respect we have for those different points of view.
   

  





 By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to be part of a
 **global, diverse environment;** 
 you will be joining a
 **winning team** 
 with a
 **commitment to sustainability;**
 and a company where we get things done so that you can
 **make a positive impact** 
 on the world.
   

  





 We’re looking for innovative and original thinkers to work in an environment where you can
 **#MakeYourMoment** 
 so that we can help others make theirs. With the power of our AI-driven solutions, we empower our team to change the status quo and make a real difference.
   

  





 If you want to change the status quo, we’ll help you make your moment. Join Team Purple. Join IFS.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 We are looking for a technical leader who is passionate about building scalable, resilient, and high-performance distributed systems. As the Lead Software Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in the design, development, and deployment of microservices architectures running on Kubernetes, driving both the technical vision and execution of our platform’s architecture.
   

  





**Key Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  




* **Microservices Architecture** 
 : Design and implement scalable and high-performance microservices architectures that can handle increasing traffic and complex workloads.
* **Kubernetes & Containerization** 
 : Lead the architecture, deployment, and management of containerized applications using Kubernetes, ensuring they are highly available, scalable, and resilient.
* **System Scalability** 
 : Ensure that the systems are designed for horizontal scalability and can handle large volumes of traffic by effectively utilizing Kubernetes and container orchestration tools.
* **Continuous Improvement** 
 : Drive the adoption of best practices and improve existing microservices, systems, and workflows to enhance system performance, reliability, and efficiency.
* **Mentorship & Leadership** 
 : Provide leadership and mentorship to engineering teams, helping to develop junior and mid-level engineers by fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing.
* **Collaboration** 
 : Work closely with product managers, designers, and other engineering teams to deliver robust, production-ready solutions that meet business goals.
* **DevOps & CI/CD** 
 : Own and lead efforts in automation of the development lifecycle, ensuring efficient deployment processes and effective use of CI/CD pipelines in a Kubernetes environment.
* **Troubleshooting & Debugging** 
 : Lead efforts in identifying, diagnosing, and resolving issues across distributed systems, ensuring system uptime and availability.
* **Security & Compliance** 
 : Implement and ensure that microservices are secure, scalable, and compliant with relevant industry standards.
* **Innovation** 
 : Stay up-to-date with the latest trends in microservices, Kubernetes, and distributed systems, applying new tools and techniques to improve our platform.


**Qualifications**

**Required Qualifications** 
 :
   

  




* **Experience** 
 : 5+ years of experience in software engineering, with at least 2 years of specialized experience in designing, implementing, and managing microservices architectures.
* **Expertise in Microservices** 
 : Strong experience designing and developing microservices-based applications and distributed systems.
* **Kubernetes & Containers** 
 : Deep expertise in Kubernetes, Docker, and container orchestration. Proficient in deploying, managing, and scaling applications in Kubernetes clusters.
* **Cloud Platforms** 
 : Proficiency with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure, with hands-on experience deploying and managing containerized applications.
* **Programming Skills** 
 : Strong coding experience in languages such as Java, or Go with an emphasis on writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code.
* **API Design & Development** 
 : Solid understanding of RESTful APIs, gRPC, and asynchronous messaging (Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc.).
* **CI/CD & DevOps** 
 : Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines, automation, and DevOps practices. Familiarity with tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI, Helm, and Terraform.
* **Monitoring & Logging** 
 : Familiarity with monitoring and logging solutions (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, etc.) to ensure the health and performance of Kubernetes-based systems.
* **Leadership Skills** 
 : Proven ability to lead and mentor engineering teams, driving projects to completion while fostering a collaborative, innovative, and high-performance environment.
* **Problem-Solving** 
 : Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze and resolve complex technical challenges in a distributed environment.



**Preferred Qualifications** 
 :
   

  




* **Cloud-Native Technologies** 
 : Familiarity with cloud-native tools and ecosystems such as service meshes (Istio, Linkerd), Helm charts, and Kubernetes Operators.
* **Microservices Frameworks** 
 : Experience with frameworks and tools that facilitate microservices architecture, such as Spring Boot, Micronaut, or similar.
* **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** 
 : Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation.
* **Distributed Tracing** 
 : Experience with distributed tracing tools like Jaeger or OpenTelemetry for debugging microservices.
* **Security** 
 : Strong knowledge of securing microservices, Kubernetes clusters, and cloud-based applications.


**Additional Information**

*We believe that coming together as a community, in person, is important for innovation, connection and fostering a sense of belonging. Our roles have the right balance of remote and in-office working to enable flexibility for managing your life along with ensuring a real connection with your colleagues and the broader IFS community.*

title: iOS Developer - Advertising Apps
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL
   

  

 You?** 
 A seasoned iOS developer who thrives on building great products, thrives at working across teams, and is always looking for ways to grow, improve, and contribute.
   

  

**Role?** 
 iOS Developer to join our Advertising APPS team to build top-notch advertising experiences on iOS that millions of users rely on.
   

  

**Tech stack?** 
 Swift, UIKit, Combine, SwiftUI. Xcode, REST APIs, Firebase, Bitrise for CI/CD, GitHub and Travis. We’ve got solid foundations, room to modernize, and a few internal SDKs to keep things interesting.
   

  

**Company?** 
 Vend, the powerhouse behind FINN, Blocket, Tori, and DBA where millions of people across the Nordics connect to find what they need, whether it’s a job, a home, a way to move, or a fresh start.
   

  

**Location?** 
 Join us in our office in Stockholm (where the rest of the application developers are), Oslo, Helsinki, or Aarhus, with the flexibility to work remotely 2-3 days a week: your choice, your balance.
   

  

**Why us?** 
 This is your chance to shape how ads show up in apps millions use daily - no dark patterns, just smart, user-friendly experiences. You are joining a team that values clean code, clear priorities, and trusts you to get things done your way.
   

  

**Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!**
**WHO ARE YOU?**
* You have senior and versatile experience in iOS development with solid experience shipping and maintaining iOS apps at scale.
* Experience with Swift, UIKit, Xcode, REST APIs and understanding of mobile architecture patterns, such as MVC, MVVM, POP.
* Comfortable with CI/CD practices, especially integrating code with tools like GitHub/BitRise etc.
* A creative thinker and self-starter, not just someone who executes, but someone who actively seeks new ways to improve and make things better.
* Interested in the business impact of your work, especially how advertising can be more effective and valuable for users and the company.
* A collaborative and inclusive player who enjoys working with developers, designers, and product managers across countries and disciplines.
* Comfortable navigating tradeoffs in product development, balancing quality, speed, and impact.
* Fluent in English, our shared language across markets and teams.
* As a person, you’re reliable and easy-going, someone others naturally trust and turn to for help with a curious and proactive mindset to ask the “why” behind things.


**WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?**
**Day-to-day work & projects cooking**
 As our new iOS Developer, you are joining the APPS team in the Advertising domain, the squad building and maintaining ad experiences in native mobile apps across several top Nordic marketplaces. Your focus is on crafting, refining, and evolving how ads appear and perform in our native iOS apps used daily by millions of people in the Nordics.
   

  

 You build and improve how advertising is experienced by users and advertisers on iOS, working closely with designers, product managers, and engineers from other disciplines. You contribute to new ad features, work in a cross-functional team on new ad features, SDK integrations, A/B tests, and platform improvements, and think creatively about what mobile advertising could look like in the future. Whether you're building shared ad modules, integrating Google Ad Manager, or experimenting with A/B tests to validate hypotheses, you're always looking for ways to improve both performance and the overall experience.
   

  

 You work closely with backend, product, and analytics teams, and you often sync with Android and web colleagues to ensure a cohesive experience across platforms. It’s a hands-on role with a good balance of legacy and greenfield work, giving you the opportunity to explore new ideas while strengthening what's already in place.
   

  

 By month six, you’ve shipped features, earned trust, and are actively shaping how we build and improve iOS apps. At the one-year mark, you’re the go-to iOS expert in the Advertising space — initiating improvements, mentoring others, and driving the roadmap forward.
   

  

**Colleagues**
 We’re a tight-knit Ads APPS team, currently 5 people: 2 iOS devs (1 full-time, 1 consultant), 2 Android devs (both consultants), and a manager, Amir. You are our new full-time iOS developer and help set the tone and direction of our team. Our culture is our strength: You are trusted to make good things happen. And you’ll be backed by a company that supports you in doing just that.
   

  

**The challenge turns into an opportunity!**
 We’re improving how we approach advertising on mobile, both technically and from a user experience angle. It’s a mix of legacy and greenfield. Your challenge is to help evolve our setup while keeping things stable, and your opportunity is to influence foundational decisions and shape the future of advertising at Vend. You are not afraid to challenge how things are done, take the lead, and experiment with bold ideas. If you're a builder, a thinker, and a collaborator, this is your playground.
   

  

**GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!**
 Turn yourself in by
 **Thurs** 
**day, 29th May.** 
 You can choose whether to send your cover letter or go through some questions we prepared to get to know you better :) We will start with the first round of interviews after the application period, to give everyone a fair shot.
   

  

**QUESTIONS?**
**Amir Alavi** 
 , Engineering Manager for Advertising Apps (amir.alavi(at)vend.com) is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the recruitment process and along its way, I, Talent Acquisition Specialist
 **Alessia Porazzi** 
 (alessia.porazzi(at)vend.com), am here for you!
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS?** 
 1
 **.** 
 First step with Talent Acquisition Specialist, Alessia
 *(your background, skills & growth goals, Schibsted as an employer)* 
 2. Second meeting with Amir and iOS developer Andreas
 *(diving deeper into your background & skills, role goals & expectations)* 
 3. Last technical meeting with the team (diving deeper into your tech competencies and thinking process)
   

  

* Reference check and offer!

title: Software Electrical RUP Engineer
description:
BROMMA has been the leading manufacturer of crane spreaders ever since its formation in the 1960s. Today we have, by far, the highest market share of the world’s spreader suppliers. In fact, our market share is higher than all our competitors’ combined. Today, we manufacture close to 2,000 spreaders of all types every year and our spreaders are currently in use in 99 of the top-100 ports world- wide.
   

  

 BROMMA sales and service network has a wide-reaching footprint. We are present with own sales offices on all continents, and with an extensive network of agents, we are able to support customers in every country in the world.
   

  

 More information about BROMMA can be found on www.bromma.com
   

  

****We're making every move count****
 We are looking for a
 **Software / Electrical RUP Engineer** 
 to join our global team.
   

  

 As a Software / Electrical RUP Engineer you will prepare and be responsible for the software and electrical design including installation instructions for upgrade projects for existing spreaders, ensure the testing and be responsible for the quality of the solutions delivered, and that it is according to required standards and directives, as well as lead and coordinate the customer projects.
   

  

****Main tasks and responsibilities****
* Prepare and responsible for RUP software, electrical design, electrical drawing specification, and installation instructions
* Create software and electrical design/BOM list for customer quotations & customer orders
* Prepare cost & price calculations for software & electrical design
* Proactively implement solutions to improve RUP quality (not only in design but also as part of the rest of the order to delivery process)
* Drive and responsible for software & electrical RUP quality (from order to delivery)
* Responsible to support software & electrical RUP projects during installation
* Develop and design testing solutions and prepare test instructions for software and electrical RUP (Retrofit & Upgrade Projects) design
* Coordinate with regional teams and engineers to ensure project execution meets technical specifications and compliance standards (e.g. CE requirements), including RUP software and electrical design
* Act as a technical representative in New Product Development projects, while also mentoring new engineers and providing technical support for spare parts and related inquiries.


****What you’ll need to succeed****
**Education**
* BSc or MSc in Software or Electrical Engineering.


**Experience**
* 7-10 years of hands-on experience in software design or electrical circuitry, ideally in industrial or heavy machinery settings.


**Technical Expertise**
* Proficiency with electrical control system and software platforms such as CoDeSys or similar
* Experience in design tools such as EPLAN, E3 PRO, or equivalent
* Understanding of machinery standards, power supply systems, and electrical control systems
* Background in service operations and evaluating designs from both internal and customer perspectives
* Strong skills in technical documentation and report writing
* Technical hands-on experience with global customer engagement
* Familiarity with Google Suite tools for day-to-day collaboration.


**Soft Skills**
* Able to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines efficiently
* Strong team player, contributing to design improvement and product growth
* Self-driven, resourceful, and creative with a problem-solving mindset
* Skilled at prioritizing resources, profitability, and market needs
* Strong technical analytical skills with an interest in sharing knowledge
* Effective communicator, delivering results and meeting customer expectations.


**Other Requirements**
* Fluent in English, writing and speaking
* Other language skills are an advantage
* Willingness to travel.


****You will be part of****
 We believe in our people as it is our people who really make the difference. We always work in close collaboration with our customers, deliver on our promises and never walk away no matter how big the challenge. We succeed because we do it together.
   

  

 With us, you will have the opportunity to realise your potential and become an important member of our global team.
   

  

****Interested to join?****
 If you're excited about this role, please submit your application until 30.05.2025.
   

  

 Bromma is part of Kalmar.
   

  

**About Kalmar**
 Kalmar (Nasdaq Helsinki: KALMAR) is moving goods in critical supply chains around the world, with the vision to be the forerunner in sustainable material handling equipment and services. The company offers a wide range of industry shaping heavy material handling equipment and services to ports and terminals, distribution centres, manufacturing and heavy logistics. Headquartered in Helsinki, Finland, Kalmar operates globally in over 120 countries and employs approximately 5,200 people. In 2024, the company's sales totalled approximately EUR 1.7 billion.
   

  

 www.kalmarglobal.com
