title: SAP S/4HANA Functional DMS Consultant
description:
**Role:**  

* own the business requirements collection and based on that the functional specification for the SAP S/4HANA DMS implementation
* Responsible for the setting up of the SAP DMS & document structure for S/4HANA system
* Integration process and installation/configuration of SAP DMS application component with other core module of SAP S/4HANA.
* Keeping the scope in mind, configure the system accordingly.
* Able to test and document the system.
* Train key users.
* Experienced with SAP Documents, Document Structure, Document Search, Document Distribution Version Management, Document Vaulting, Integrated Viewer Status Management, Document Conversion, Document workflow, Interfacing Table specification.
* Should be also versed with the integration aspects of SAP DMS applications with other core modules of S/4HANA.
* Experience with SER Doxis4 and SAP ECTR, SAP PLM Cloud will be an advantage.
* Setting up SAP Knowledge management, SAP content server, experienced with Metadata search & configuration and Integration with workflow configuration, Enterprise search, integration and Security associated with DMS implementation .
* Should have worked with associated standard workflows across MM, QM and PM


Experience in the setup of archive link to support retention of POs and Invoices and other documents.  

* Document migration from SAP DMS to other ECM solutions
**Essential requirements:**  

* Experience in SAP Document Management implementation on S/4HANA
* Experience in SAP Workflows configuration
* Some knowledge and experience of SAP Enterprise Asset Management or further ERP modules making use of SAP DMS
* Compliance with all IT security rules
* Preferably has knowledge of SAP ECTR and SAP PLM Cloud

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Stockholm  

**Period**: 19-05-2025-31-12-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 20-05-2025  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
**Software Engineering Manager**

**Are you passionate about software and leadership? Would you like to join a growing software development company and lead a team who develop important parts of our core products, Astro WMS and Astro WCS?**

**We are now looking for a Software Engineering Manager to join our R&D organization.**

**Who we are**


Consafe Logistics is a software development company. We design a product and technology that makes warehouse operations of logistics and supply chain companies smarter, more effective, and thus more sustainable. We’ve been in the business for more than 40 years, providing warehouse management systems for many great brands and organizations all over the globe, and we still love doing it!


We also know that we would be nothing without our talented co-workers. Our ambition is to become the most attractive workplace in the supply chain industry in Europe, so we continuously strive to provide them with long-term development and career opportunities. Learn more about us here.

**About the role**


We are looking for a technically skilled software manager to lead part of the software organization at R&D in Lund, Sweden. You’ll report to the CTO, be part of the R&D leadership team and play a critical part in driving and continuously refining our technology vision and at the same time leading a team who develop important parts of the core product


The employees in the broader R&D organization (where you and your team are part) are daily working on many interesting challenges and areas such as: architecture, design and implementation of the core logic of the WMS and WCS, cyber security related to the solution, controlling complex warehouse automation, digital twin, web technology, SaaS/Cloud technology, AI and machine learning. The whole R&D organization works closely together, so even though you will have a few focus areas of responsibility, you and your team will also have the possibility to contribute to several of these areas.

**Profile**


Ideally you are a person who is passionate about both leadership as well as being able to understand software architecture, design and implementation yourself, so you can have an involvement in driving our projects forward together with your team. We expect you to be technical enough to engage in meaningful discussions about design and architecture with your engineers and other stakeholders. Any experience in WMS (Warehouse Management Systems) or logistics is a plus, but not a must, since you will learn what you need to know.

**Required experience**

* B.Sc. or higher in Software Engineering or similar corresponding experience
* Previous experience in leading and coaching software teams
* Good understanding of software architecture, design and implementation in various languages
* General understanding of modern software systems and related topics (web, REST APIs, security, micro-services, relational databases, etc.)
* Understanding of software engineering standard methodologies (CI/CD, unit testing, etc.)
* Minimum 5 years of leadership experience
* Passion to recruit, hire and build high-performance engineering teams


The exact technology stacks you have experience of is not important since we believe you are able to learn what you need to if you have a passion for software in general.


However, you may still want to know that we work with a combination of .NET (both .NET Framework and .NET Core), TypeScript (React), some Python and SQL on multiple operating systems. Major parts of the backend are also developed in C/C++. The server logic incorporates complex algorithms for warehouse process optimization. On the client side, we develop solutions for web, desktop, mobile and handheld devices.

**What we offer our co-workers**

**Professional growth and an inspiring business environment:** We are on an exciting growth journey, and this role will have a huge impact on our future success. You will have the opportunity to work together with a prominent international brand and drive the evolution of state-of-the-art WMS solutions for the future.

**A strong community:** At Consafe Logistics, we live by our three core behaviors, Together We Get There, Be Accountable and Act and Strive for Greatness. We have an open and inclusive company culture, where we always find occasions to celebrate and have fun together.

**Other**


This job is a permanent full-time position in Lund, Sweden. Please send in your application as soon as possible. We will review candidates continuously.


For more information, please contact recruiting manager and CTO Andreas Anyuru, andreas.anyuru@consafelogistics.com or Chief People officer Brita Ohlin, brita.ohlin@consafelogistics.com

**We are looking forward to your application!**

title: Software and HIL Test Engineer
description:
**Job Title: Software & HIL Test Engineer**

**About Echandia Marine**


Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact.

**About the Role**


We are seeking a Software Test Engineer with HIL (Hardware-in-the-Loop) experience to join our software development team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software solutions, spanning from an embedded platform to the cloud.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop and execute automated test suites for software components and systems.
* Develop and maintain test frameworks and infrastructure using Python, C# or NodeJS.
* Integrate software with hardware systems, including HIL setups.
* Work closely with software developers to identify and troubleshoot software defects.
* Plan, design and build physical test systems and upgrade existing setups
* Develop and maintain test documentation and reports.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest testing methodologies and tools.
* Collaborate effectively within a cross-functional team.

**Required Skills:**

* Strong software engineering fundamentals.
* Experience with test automation frameworks and methodologies.
* Proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: Python, C#, NodeJS.
* Experience with hardware integration and automation (e.g., CAN, Modbus).
* Experience in building physical test systems
* Good understanding of electronics and embedded systems
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

**Bonus Points:**

* Experience with Agile development methodologies.
* Experience with Linux systems administration.
* Experience with CI/CD and build automation with GitHub Actions
* Experience with automated web ui testing.
* Experience with embedded software development.
* Good understanding of batteries
* ISTQB certifications is a merit.
* Knowledge of specific industry standards or regulations.

title: Senior Penetration Tester
description:
**Role** **– Senior Penetration Tester**


*Title:* Senior Penetration Tester


*Location:* Hybrid/ Naples / Rome / Italy


*Job type:* Full-Time Permanent


*Salary:* Negotiable / DOE

  


**About Us**



Integrity360 is one of Europe’s leading cyber security specialists operating from office locations spread out across Europe, providing a comprehensive range of professional, support and managed cyber security services for our 300+ clients. With four top-class Security Operation Centers, we offer a complete end-to-end security services covering our clients’ security from every angle. Our services include Managed Security, Cyber Security Testing, Incident Response, Security Integration, PCI Compliance and Cyber Risk & Assurance services.



What sets Integrity360 apart is our excellent team of people that drive the business forward. The company was founded with a focus on technical expertise and that philosophy remains today. The skills and experience in our company are some of the greatest in the industry and clients remain with Integrity360 because they can rely on and trust us to go above and beyond to ensure their needs are met. Listed multiple times on Gartner Market Guides for Managed Security Services.

  


**Job Role / Responsibilities**



This position is responsible for performing all forms of complex technical security assessments of clients’ information technology systems (including the Internet, Intranet, Applications, Hosts, Firewalls, Mobile applications etc.) and related policies and procedures. Communication in both written and verbal forms, including training courses, workshops, consultations with clients and formal reports. These assessments are conducted on a by-project basis, ranging between one and three weeks per project, and will occasionally be done at the client site. This role is also required to conduct ongoing research in the IT security arena and regularly assisting in the sales process.

  


**Primary Duties/Responsibilities include:**


* Perform security reviews of architecture and application designs, as well as application source code reviews
* Perform mobile, complex application, infrastructure, as well as social engineering assessments and penetration testing
* Exploit vulnerabilities to gain access, and expand access to remote systems
* Document technical issues identified during security assessments
* Assist with building, hardening, and maintaining systems used for penetration testing
* Research cutting edge security topics and new attack vectors
* Assist with improvements for Integrity360’s security services, including the continuous enhancement of existing methodology and reporting formats, as well as training collateral
* Communication of findings/innovations internally, to colleagues
* Represent Integrity36 at international events, forums or training events
* Demonstrate the ability to be an industry expert
* Mentor team members

  


**Desire****d** **Skills**


* Solid experience in information security
* Industry experience working in Dev/Admin/Engineer field
* Industry experience working in Information security field as a penetration tester
* Development and/or source code review experience in C/C++, C#, VB.NET, ASP, PHP, Java, Python or Ruby
* Strong Unix, Windows and networking security skills
* Familiarity with general application and network security concepts
* Excellent communication skills
* Manual penetration testing experience above and beyond running automated tools
* Experience developing custom scripts or tools used for vulnerability scanning and identification
* In depth networking knowledge (MPLS, BGP, OSPF, IPv6, TOR)
* Understanding of development frameworks
* Broad understanding of hosting /cloud environment
* Broad understanding of SIEM & Defensive Technologies.
* Understanding of Security Auditing tools
* Ethical hacking experience
* Intrusion prevention experience
* Report writing experience
* Presentation skills
* Scripting/coding, sys admin or networking experience
* Understanding of programming methodologies
* Understanding of quality management and project management principles
* Knowledge of advance cloud architecture

  


**Certifications/Qualifications**


* CHECK Team Leader or equivalent
* IT related degree or certificate
* One of the industry leading qualifications (OSCP, CREST, OSCE, OSWP)
company_addresses: Integrity360, The Concourse, Block D, Beacon Court, Sandyford, Co. Dublin, Ireland
company_description: Integrity360 is one of Europe's leading cyber security services and solutions provider.

title: Sr. Enterprise Account Manager, Europe North Enterprise Greenfield, Europe North Enterprise Greenfield
description:
- Experience as a quota carrying technology enterprise field sales or business development account manager, including complex account management and greenfield/new business experience.
- The ideal candidate will have experience developing relationships across industry verticals, including: Financial Services Industry (FSI), Manufacturing, Media & Entertainment and/or Retail/CPG.
- Experience increasing technology adoption and creating long term transformational account strategies, and demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise Customers, including working with and presenting to C-level executives, IT, and other lines of business.
- Swedish language: native or fluent business speaker.
  

Would you like to be part of a talented team of experienced technical sales professionals focused on winning and growing new business with some of Sweden's largest Enterprises as they transform their business? As an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Senior Enterprise Account Manager in our Enterprise Growth team, you will have the exciting opportunity of driving digital transformation across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio.
AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology and support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
Key job responsibilities
As an AWS Senior Enterprise Account Manager in our Enterprise Greenfield (new business) team, you are driving digital transformations through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, developers, and various lines of businesses. You are establishing AWS as the key cloud technology provider across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio to Enterprise Customers.
A day in the life
On a daily basis you empower your customers to solve challenges while attaining both their operational and innovation goals. You deliver business outcomes while guiding them to become more agile, innovative, and efficient. With AWS, our customers benefit from the fastest pace of innovation, the broadest and deepest functionality, the most secure computing environment, and the most proven operational expertise.
Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact?
Come build the future with us.
About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
  

* 10 years+ of technology field sales or business development experience, ideally selling cloud solutions
* Experience developing long term customer relationships, with multiple lines of business, including senior CxO stakeholders
* Active listener and effective communicator with demonstrated success in effective deal closing skills on large, complex deals
* Extensive working knowledge with CRMs (e.g. Salesforce), forecasting, account plan creation and ownership
* Demonstrated success in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale technology projects to Enterprise customers
* A passionate, self-starter, ready to take AWS Sweden Enterprise customer experience to the next level

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, with over 200 powerful services that enable our customers and our people to make more of an impact.

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **Join Us in Revolutionizing the Future of Transportation!**  

At AMT, we are on a mission to innovate and drive sustainability in the transport industry. If you're ready to be part of a transformative journey, we invite you to join our team and work with next-generation technologies that will shape a better tomorrow.  

  

**About the Role**  

As a Platform Engineer at AMT, you will be at the forefront of redefining how we design, develop, and deploy tools for our internal teams and end users. Your creativity in creating services based on Service and Parts information and your leadership in cross-functional initiatives will be crucial as you translate complex needs into actionable deliverables, contributing to the broader transformation of the transport sector.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Envision and Drive the development of innovative tools and processes by collaborating with cross-functional teams
* Explore how AI can be applied to our current processes, increasing quality and efficiency
* Investigate user needs, define project requirements, and establish clear roadmaps for successful execution.
* Translate roadmaps into actionable deliverables, overseeing their implementation from start to finish.

 **Your Future Team**  

Join a dynamic, global team of talented engineers who thrive on collaboration, continuous improvement, and knowledge sharing. We believe in hands-on learning, and you will have the unique opportunity to work directly with our trucks in the workshop, gaining invaluable experience.  

  

**Who Are You?**


We are looking for a passionate, forward-thinking engineer who dreams big and takes action. To excel in this role, you should possess:

* A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science and AI, Mechanical, Mechatronic, Electrical Engineering, Systems Information or education and experience that we consider equivalent.
* Fluency in English with strong communication skills.
* Strong systems understanding and experience with microservices and micro front end.
* Hands-on knowledge of artificial intelligence.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS or Google Cloud.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Javascript, Python, SQL, or R.

 **It´s a merit if you have:**

* Experience in data analysis and data platforms. (for instance: experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka, and knowledge of data warehousing solutions like Snowflake or Redshift)
* Strong understanding of the aftermarket business.

 **Why Join AMT?**  

At AMT, you will be part of a global movement driving innovation and sustainability in the transport industry. With access to cutting-edge technologies and a collaborative work environment, you will have the opportunity to make a lasting impact on a global scale.  

  

**Ready to Shape the Future of Sustainable Transport?**  

If you're excited to join us in building a better tomorrow, apply no later than the 26th of May and let’s create the future together!  

  

You are welcome to contact Hiring Manager Juliana Pintarelli, juliana.pintarelli@volvo.com, if you have questions regarding this opportunity!

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Product Lead Data Analytics
description:
Are you a proficient data analyst with familiarity and passion for creating value out of data? Are you eager to find data related opportunities and help mitigating pain points and help increasing accuracy in important decision making, while at the same time coming to completion with previous tasks? Are you thriving when working in a small and agile team?

  

Data and data-driven development and decision making is rapidly maturing and making more and more advances into our industry. Volvo Group is not an exception, and we are now looking for you who want to work with enhancing our development operations and services with data analytics and data insights! Are you an innovative and committed person who wants to join us in this endeavor? Together we drive the data transformation. By joining us, you’ll be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who work with passion, trust each other, and embrace change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.

 **About the role:**


We are a relatively new team with the mission to drive our analytics journey with the aim of making the organization become more proficient in using data and creating insights – to become more data-driven. We do that by understanding the pain points at hand and engage in the necessary data engineering and science efforts.

  

As a product lead you will stay in tight contact with the team’s stakeholders and continuously keep the backlog updated and broken down to meet their expectations. This includes leading the team’s PI planning and demo sessions, managing risks, promoting best practice and fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will also be responsible for the team roadmap and strategies and work tightly with other experts in the field to make sure that the team deliveries are up to date with the latest technological developments and meet business strategic goals. In addition to the above, you will also need to engage in technical data engineering/science/analyst work, such as finding adequate data, developing necessary pipelines and visualizing the result in a pedagogic and comprehensible format that allows for drawing the right conclusions.

  

Welcome to an exciting role, where you will have the opportunity to shape the future.

 **More information about the role:**

* You will be part of a team that will spearhead the use of data analytics into our development and decision processes.
* You work in an agile manner with a focus on showcasing implemented results.
* You interact with other development teams to understand their painpoints better than they do themselves.

 **Who are you?**


You are someone with a curious and strategic mindset on the future while staying in touch with today’s challenges. You are a responsible team player who engages your team and likes to collaborate to meet the expectations of our stakeholders on our deliveries. You see opportunities and are ready to take the initiative and act on them. You never say no at first – you try things out before deciding if something works or doesn’t work. While staying rooted in data engineering, data analytics and software development, you are flexible in working with a variety of tasks in different application areas.

 **Requirements:**

* At least an MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics or similar
* You have an eye for making sense of data to others
* Proficiency in software development and database querying, in particular Python and SQL
* Experience of working with large datasets on data platforms and systems, such as DataBricks and PowerBI
* Good verbal and written communication skills in English
* You are a people’s person who loves to collaborate and build relationships.

 **Desired skills and experience:**

* Familiarity of working with SQL servers, Cloud environments or Hadoop clusters
* Familiarity with Parquet files, XML schemas, SQL tables and other common data formats
* Familiarity with automotive software or system engineering

  

For further information, please contact Daniel Karlsson, manager Data analytics & AI. E-mail: daniel.b.karlsson@volvo.com.

 **Last Application date: 2nd June 2025**

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Oslo
description:
Do you want to be a key player in a company that empowers people to make smarter and more informed financial decisions?  

Would you also like to work in an entrepreneurial environment across Scandinavia, striving to reach a growing number of users with services that help them save money and improve their personal finances?



If yes, this is your opportunity to join **Lendo**, the leading **marketplace for loans in Scandinavia**!



At Lendo, we help people navigate consumer loans, car loans, credit cards and mortgages. Operating in **Norway, Sweden, and Denmark**, we are a team of **250+ talented colleagues** working every day to make personal finance management easier.

  

**Why Join Us?**



You’ll be part of an open-minded, agile, and cross-functional team that loves solving problems and driving innovation! At Lendo, everyone has an impact—our tech teams work closely with the business, directly contributing to the continuous improvement of both our technology and product offerings.  

  

We offer an international and inclusive work environment, with team members from over 20 different countries. Our office is centrally located at Tøyen Torg in Oslo, making it easily accessible and close to the city's vibrant atmosphere. Here, you have the freedom to work in your own way and grow in your role.



To inspire and nurture your passion, we organize hackathons, knowledge-sharing events, and encourage participation in conferences. You will also have access to our learning platform, skilled colleagues as sparring partners, and a budget for professional development.



Our benefits include a pension plan, insurance, and parental benefits. Additionally, you can enjoy a subsidized lunch in our canteen, offering a variety of food options. To foster a strong team spirit, we regularly host team activities and fun parties throughout the year!

  

**A look at what you will do**


* Use tech such as Kubernetes, Docker, PostgreSQL, AWS Services, CI/CD
* Build and maintain Java Spring Boot and Spring Cloud services, used in our integrations.
* Work on migrating our remaining services from a monolithic to a microservice architecture
* Design and implement APIs to ensure smooth service communication.
* Continuously create exciting new products and features, collaborating closely with colleagues
* Write tests at different levels to ensure the quality in your code
* Identify and keep track of metrics that tell you how our software is performing
* Collaborate closely with colleagues and the business to increase value for our customers and partners
* Prioritise work with the team and the Product managers
* Be creative and brainstorm ideas for ways we can further streamline our development
* Bring your own unique skill set to the table. Experiment, test, try, fail and learn all the time
* Work in a hybrid environment with at least 2 office days a week

  
SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS


* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
* 5+ years of experience in backend development
* Excellent knowledge of Java or similar languages
* Knowledge of Spring Boot is preferable
* Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Write well-structured, efficient, and maintainable code and actively improve the quality of the codebase
* Give good reviews, and don't shy away from a constructive discussion
* Be a curious engineer and proactive in your ways of working
* Actively engage in fostering a great team culture
* Be open-minded and cooperate well with others; share knowledge, experience and information effectively through oral and written communication  

  

*Sounds interesting?*  

**Apply today!** Deadline for applications is 2025-05-31

title: SAP S/4HANA Functional DMS
description:
**Company Description**  

We are a IT & Tech consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!


We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.  

  

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level. With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking an experienced **SAP S/4HANA Functional DMS Consultant** to support the implementation of a comprehensive Document Management System (DMS) within Vattenfall’s ERP transformation program. This role involves functional design, system configuration, data migration, and integration of SAP DMS with core S/4HANA modules. The ideal candidate will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver a secure, scalable, and efficient document management solution.


This is a **hybrid position**, requiring regular onsite collaboration at the **Solna office (minimum once per week)** and **monthly business travel** to other core countries.

 **Key Responsibilities**

* Lead the collection and analysis of business requirements for SAP S/4HANA DMS.
* Develop and maintain functional specifications for DMS implementation.
* Configure and implement SAP DMS document structures in line with project scope.
* Integrate SAP DMS with core SAP modules including MM, QM, PM, and EAM.
* Conduct system testing (unit, integration, UAT) and ensure proper documentation.
* Train and support key users and business stakeholders.
* Manage document lifecycle processes such as versioning, distribution, and vaulting.
* Design and configure workflows related to document management.
* Ensure DMS implementation meets IT security and compliance standards.
* Execute and oversee document migration from legacy DMS to ECM solutions.
* Set up SAP ArchiveLink to support document retention for POs, invoices, and other records.
* Implement Knowledge Management tools and metadata search capabilities.
* Collaborate across departments to support international implementation needs.

 **Qualifications** **Experience & Skills**

* Proven experience in **SAP DMS implementation in S/4HANA environments**.
* Expertise in **SAP document management**, including document structure, search, workflows, and security.
* Strong functional knowledge of SAP integration with **MM, QM, PM**, and related modules.
* Experience with **SAP Workflow configuration** and standard workflow across modules.
* Familiarity with **SAP Knowledge Management**, **content servers**, and metadata configuration.
* Experience with **document migration and archiving** tools such as ArchiveLink.
* Advantageous to have exposure to **SER Doxis4**, **SAP ECTR**, and **SAP PLM Cloud**.
* Strong understanding of IT compliance, document security, and governance.
* Ability to operate in a hybrid and multinational environment.

**Education & Certifications**

* Background in **SAP S/4HANA** implementations with hands-on project experience.
* SAP certifications related to DMS, S/4HANA, or related modules (preferred).

 **Additional Information** **Start:** Immediately  

**Working hours:** 100%  

**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden  

**Form of employment:** Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months of probationary employment

***Relocation to Sweden (from outside CET timezone) is also possible for this role.***

title: Senior Data Architect & Machine Learning Lead
description:
MacGregor is a global company that operates in 30 countries with 2000 employees. We provide sustainable cargo and load handling with a strong portfolio of products, services, and solutions to the maritime and offshore industries. Our solutions are found in over half of the world's merchant fleet.

  

We believe MacGregor is a great place to work and we are looking for innovators with an international mindset to join our team and help us create lifetime value for our customers.

**MacGregor – Let's shape the future together**
-----------------------------------------------


Our company is undergoing an exciting transformation that aims at creating and delivering lifetime value for our customers. Digital products and services are at the heart of this transformation, playing a critical role in driving innovation and delivering exceptional customer experiences.

  

We're seeking an experienced data professional to pioneer our data and analytics capabilities. As our first dedicated data expert in the team, you'll work at the intersection of data architecture, analytics, and machine learning - both setting the strategic vision for data insights area within the digital development team and delivering hands-on solutions that drive business value and customer value.

  

You will be surrounded by enthusiastic and talented colleagues, always believing the best results can be reached by an open and collaborative team. You’ll be asked to contribute to finding solutions of all kinds and developing our vision together, using all your creativity, expertise and experience. You will gain a team you can trust on, giving you all the support necessary so together we can shape MacGregor’s future in the digital maritime landscape.

**More tasks and responsibilities**
-----------------------------------

* Define, develop and implement the data strategy and architecture to support both customer-facing digital products and internal business needs
* Design, build, and deploy analytics solutions and ML models for actionable insights
* Create and implement scalable data pipelines, cloud infrastructure, and processing systems
* Lead collaboration with teams (product, engineering, business) to identify data-driven opportunities
* Establish best practices for data management, quality, and governance
* Advise on technical decisions related to data infrastructure, tools and technology
* Build data application proof of concepts and prototypes
* Identify data competence growth areas within the Digital Development team
* Lay the groundwork for expanding our data capabilities as the organization grows

  

This role is within the Digital Development in Global Services Division. Reporting directly to the Senior Manager, Digital Development. This position can be based in Sweden, Germany, Finland, Poland for the suitable candidate it can be also considered in any other MacGregor service location in Europe.

  

Travelling is occasionally required during the year. Together we will try to find an appropriate solution to not let this be a problem for you.

**What you’ll need to succeed**
-------------------------------


You're a versatile data professional who enjoys both building systems and extracting insights. You're also comfortable being the go-to expert for all things data while also rolling up your sleeves to create working solutions. You are motivated and have experience to build a future data expert team from scratch. You thrive in environments where you can shape the direction of data initiatives and have a tangible impact on the business.

  

Ideally you have

  

* 5+ years in data science, analytics, ML engineering, or related
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or related field (Master's preferred)
* Strong communication skills for explaining complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Ability to leverage technology to solve business challenges and deliver impactful data solutions
* Strong experience with ETL pipelines and building predictive models (e.g. linear regression, neural networks, random forest etc.)
* Strong programming in big data processing (e.g., Pyarrow, DuckDB) and data processing frameworks
* Hands-on experience building and deploying production ML models
* Knowledge of modern data lake architecture patterns and best practices
* Experience setting up and operating ML environments/pipelines in cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)
* Fluent in English both written and spoken

  

Nice to have

  

* Experience with google analytics and/or other major analytics platforms
* Experience with industrial IoT edge computing solutions is highly preferred
* Experience with creating ML models for IoT edge devices, running both inference and training on the devices
* Passionate about AI scene and latest trends
**Why MacGregor?**
------------------


Our people are behind every success. People create the technology and product lifecycle solutions that make us great, our people are the ones who innovate, and people drive our business forward. With us you will be part of an international collaborative working culture with challenges and opportunities to further develop yourself professionally. We enable sustainable global maritime operations by maximizing efficiency in cargo and load handling.

  

Values guide our work

* **Integrity** steers all our thinking, behaviour and the relationships with our customers and other stakeholders
* **Quality** is valued in our processes, products and services and helps to improve our customers’ performance and our own competences
* **Safety** is essential in everything we do

  

MacGregor is an equal opportunity employer. We recognise that diversity is key to our continued success, and strive to maintain a fair and equitable recruitment process for all applicants.

  

What we offer

  

* Opportunity to transform a large multinational company into a strong data driven solution provider
* Opportunities for career development and professional growth
* A diverse, open, collaborative and supportive work environment
* Flexible working time and location
**Additional information**
--------------------------


Do you have questions regarding the role? Please contact Jophee Wang, Senior Manager, Digital Development at Jophee.Wang@macgregor.com.  

Kindly note that we will only review CVs and applications submitted in English through our recruitment portal. Unfortunately we do not consider CVs sent per email.  

If you are ready to step into an exciting new role where you can make a significant impact and contribute to the success of MacGregor, apply today!

  

www.macgregor.com

title: Shift Leader Front Office Scandic Talk
description:
\*\*Scandic Talk\*\* är beläget vägg i vägg med Stockholmsmässan, ett stenkast från pendeltågsstationen. Hos oss är ingen dag den andra lik – mässor, events och internationella kongresser skapar en dynamisk och spännande atmosfär. Trots att hotellet reser sig hela 19 våningar över marken är känslan på hotellet familjär. Vi är en liten organisation som präglas av trivsel, personlig utveckling och en stor gemenskap med alla som arbetar på hotellet. Vi lyssnar på våra gäster och älskar att leverera god service – allt för att kunna erbjuda den allra bästa hotellupplevelsen. Delar du vår passion för gemenskap och service? Då är du den vi söker!


**Nu söker vi en Shift Leader till Scandic Talk.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Som Shift Leader agerar du värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Under din tid hos oss kan dessa områden variera i takt med att du och affären utvecklas. Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad innebär rollen som Shift Leader Front Office?**



Du som arbetar inom Front Office är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning. Arbetet i Front Office innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet.



I rollen som Shift Leader har du, förutom att vara en del av driften, den övergripande överblicken över gästflödet och ser tillsammans med teamet till att prioritera arbetsuppgifter så att verksamheten flyter så att gästerna blir nöjda. Du leder och fördelar arbetet och hanterar bemanningen under ditt arbetspass. Vid behov får du utbilda nya medarbetare på hotellet och du avlastar också Front Office Manager med vissa administrativa arbetsuppgifter.



Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Din kompetens**



För den här rollen krävs att du har både förmåga och vilja att arbeta med ett driftsnära ledarskap. Du är trygg i ditt ledarskap och har både integritet och säljdriv. För att passa i rollen tror vi också att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster. Du är en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.



Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


**Information om tjänsten:**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!


Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

title: Application Support
description:
Trintech is a multi-award winning cloud-based Fintech provider and we are looking for our next proactive and dynamic Application Support Consultant to join our EMEA team. This is an entry-level role which works directly with Accounting and IT professionals across several countries whose firms utilize Trintech solutions. This customer-facing role provides first-tier application support to customers via phone, web or email communications and confirms appropriate solutions effectively meet and exceed customer expectations.


**WHAT YOU'LL DO**


* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Work with customers to identify, troubleshoot, and solve issues being reported
* Work cross functionally with other team resources to efficiently resolve reported issues from customers, as well as appropriately escalating complex issues to SME's, SaaS team, and technical experts
* Provide excellent support for at least one Trintech application
* Monitor and maintain Key Performance Indicators (KPI) to ensure alignment with business objectives


**WHO YOU ARE**


* 0-2 years of customer service experience in a SaaS Software environment desired
* Strong verbal and written communication skills required
* Exceptional deductive reasoning and analytical skills
* Basic/intermediate SQL knowledge and GenAI Prompt Engineering required
* Experience using Salesforce or other CRM ticketing systems
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office products


At our core, Trintechers stand committed to fostering a culture rooted in our core values – Humble, Empowered, Reliable, and Open. Together, these values guide our actions, define our identity, and inspire us to continuously strive for excellence in everything we do.


*Should you require (or need) accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please provide your requirements to* *recruiting@trintech.com* *and we will work with you to accommodate your needs.*


*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.*

title: SAP S/4HANA DMS Consultant
description:
**Company Description**  

Vi är ett konsultföretag med ett gäng teknikintresserade och glada människor!


Vi älskar teknik, vi älskar design och vi älskar kvalitet. Vår mångfald gör oss unika och skapar en inkluderande och välkomnande arbetsplats där varje individ är högt värderad.


Hos oss är varje individ sig själv och respekterar andra för den de är. Vi tror att när en fantastisk mix av människor samlas och delar sin kunskap, sina erfarenheter och idéer, kan vi hjälpa våra kunder på en helt annan nivå.


Vi söker dig som kan börja omgående och vill växa med oss!


Hos oss har du stora möjligheter att ta verkliga kliv i din karriär och chansen att ta stort ansvar.

 **Job Description**  

We’re looking for an experienced **SAP S/4HANA DMS Consultant** to lead a key migration project in Stockholm.

* Set up and configure SAP DMS in S/4HANA
